Reviews.Title: “Good location but no value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chandrasekhar V
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently during the Eid holidays from 4 to 8 Nov 2011. Certainly no value for money. From day one there was no hot water in the toilets. Front desk wouldnt even look at me when I complained. The manager refused to talk to me and all insisted the problem was fixed. They even suggested I should boil water in the kettle and have a sponge bath or else go to their other facility a kilometre away to have a bath. The soft mini bar is well stocked with all of 2 small water bottles. The complimentary wifi in all rooms was non existent. Had to go down to the lobby to use my ipad. The restaurant is a joke. My family and I ate only breakfast and the food was far from satisfactory. Health club is a big empty hall - probably still under construction. No pool though they did say we could use their facilities in their adjoining property a kilometer away. Mattress on the extra cot asked for and provided was as hard as a plank of wood. Their brochure says airport transfer is complimentary, but when I asked for it, they said they normally charge Dhs 60 but for me it is free ( probably a measure to compensate me for no hot water in the rooms!!) All in all poor facilities, indifferent service from staff and a sour note in anotherwise enjoyable holiday for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place and location”
Reviews.Author: HappyChappy16
Reviews.Content: The staff were all helpful and the suites are good. Basic it maybe but you cannot complain at the reasonable rates charged plus you get a good WIFI service for free!. There is the odd minor thing here and there but we will definitely be going back there. The breakfasts might not suit everyone but we had no complaints it was always very good and the staff were ready to meet your reasonable requests.The location is ideal with access to all modes of local transport, plenty of eating places from basic to high quality all at reasonable prices. There is plenty to do around the area. The front office staff are helpful and polite. What more can you say....Well done to the London Crown Hotel look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “value for money , location but lacks "hospitality" feel”
Reviews.Author: pcontact
Reviews.Content: Being located next to the Metro station and the Creek is probably the only advantage for this rather uninteresting hotel. the staff looks totally demotivated , just pulling their days and place lacks the "hospitality" factor by far, purely a functional place with minimum comforts and cleanliness, good enough for the price you pay for a short stay. Nothing worthwhile highlighting, except to "reduce your expectations" to zero whilst taking advantage of the central location. Good for traditional families as no bar/restaurant and the property is alcohol free.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: OlegU1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not so bad and not so good. Food in hotel- 2.5 from 5. Location is good, near metro station and big store Burjuman. Taxi available every time. From hotel to the Jumeira beach Park- 26 AED (5 EUR) one way.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: playmix
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in excellent place, just next to the metro station and one of the shopping mall as well as the bus station for the City Bus Tour. It takes only 15min by metro to/from the DXB airport. Rooms are large and nicely decorated. Wifi works fine. Check-in is available from 2pm but I was there at 8am and the room was ready for me

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HawkDhaka
Reviews.Content: Very good location. One minute walk to the Khalid Bin Al Waleed Metro station. Burjuman Shoping Mall is just across the road. Room was being cleaned every day. Staffs were very cooperative. Breakfast was OK. Wi-fi covers the whole hotel and is free. We stayed in a suite and is very spacious. Big LCD TV in the room. But it is a basic hotel with no swimming pool. Since we stayed in the hotel at night and spent the entire day visiting places, it was OK for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: christian_nilson
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in mid-November. My wife works in Abu Dhabi and I flew into Dubai, so we stayed the first weekend there. I found the hotel perfectly adequate, and the room price (including breakfast) was more than reasonable. The room was simple, but had good beds. WiFi worked without a problem. The location is excellent, close to the metro and the Bur Juman Mall (also good for the sight-seeing buses!). Breakfast had a very Indian flavour - no problem, since I like Indian, but might be a bit of an acquired taste for some people. Staff were reasonably friendly and sorted out the key card problems promptly. Make sure that you don't carry your key card in the same pocket as your phone - the chip is likely to get wiped and thus won't work! Needed to leave the car and luggage in the hotel before our departure for a few hours after check-out, which was no problem. On the matter of parking, the hotel has underground parking, which is nice if a bit cramped. In all, a perfectly adequate and reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for its price and location”
Reviews.Author: janedoodle
Reviews.Content: Moved here for 2 nights after 5 nights at the Radisson Deira, because my travel plans could not be confirmed earlier. It's no Radisson both in terms of service and rooms, but the location was EXCELLENT in terms of proximity to metro and restaurants (in BurJuman). Other good things included fast Wi-Fi, and better than expected breakfast spread -- there was a selection of bread, juices, and hot servings which included omelette and other local dishes. What brought me here was also the non-requirement of a room deposit and absence of cancellation charges. Our room was quite small but nicely coordinated. We were barely able to open up our 21 and 24inch luggages and leave walking space in the room though. This is partly due to the super single sized beds, which are comfortable, but came with only one flat pillow. The bathroom was small and simply furnished. It looked clean enough, until I drew the shower curtain and was hit by a stench of sweat. Nothing a spray of hot water and shower foam couldn't remove though. One of the bath towels also had numerous brown stains on it. Additionally, the fixtures did not seem to be fitted properly -- water leaked from the shower pipe, and the WC moved slightly when you sat on it. We found bad fittings and infrastructure to be a common problem throughout the hotel. The room door lock looked as if it could come off if someone gave it several good yanks. It was not bad enough to concern us though. Inside the room, the TV remote control, desk lamp, one of the electric outlets and one of the wall lights in the room all did not work. The worst part was that we had a 40min POWER OUTAGE during our first night around 9pm. The entire hotel did not have power except the emergency lights in the corridors. However, the staff made no move to keep guests updated (we had no idea if someone was coming to fix it, etc) nor apologise or offer to make up for this in any way. I must state that we did not take this up with the staff the next morning either. A comparatively minor inconvenience is that cab drivers usually mistake London Crown 1 and 2 for this. It will help to know exactly where it is (look up wikimapia for location) so that you can direct the driver. All in all, I would stay here again if all I need is a cheap (AED275 including taxes, breakfast and wifi), comfortable bed that is near the metro and restaurants. Remember that electricity is not to be taken for granted, so bring a torch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - 5/5”
Reviews.Author: kainelsmore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the London Crown for 3 nights in early October 2010 and was very impressed with the hotel. Location is great - a few steps to the Metro Station which, when the full lines are completed will be fantastic. Only quibble here is that I couldn't actually find the hotel when I got off the metro from the airport - thanks to a local taxi driver I made it! Value - second to none, I am still astonished at how cheap the accommodation was for the quality. Food - didn't try the food though brekkie always smelt great. I wandered down to the Dome cafe / restaurant next to Burjuman for brekkie each day. Service - staff were helpful, polite. All in all, I will definitely stay again should I make it back to Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, Good Location, Good Food, & Very Good Rates..”
Reviews.Author: Vickks
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in junior suite room for 3 nites and I got the best rates for this rooms. Location of the hotel is perfect almost 100m away is Burjuman Mall & Metro Station. Breakfast was better then expected, good Indian/vegetarian b/f. Room cleaning is not so good. Toilets found messed after room cleaning. Overall I liked the hotel for its food, Location, and rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: AlistairF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the London Crown Hotel for 7 nights while in Dubai. It is very conveniently located near BurJuman Shopping Centre as well as the Metro Station. It is also very easy to get on to all the major highways if you rent a car. The room was clean and well kept. Wifi is available throughout the hotel and TV channels are decent too. I had to stay a few hours longer than my checkout time and the staff was very accommodating and didnt have a problem with that. Housekeeping staff was very nice as well. If i had to be picky, I would say the night staff at the front desk didnt look very happy and didnt value customer service as much. It wasnt a big problem though. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: switchedon
Reviews.Content: the property is located at the metro station of bur juman shopping mall. a neat clean hoet with courteous staff

HotelInfo.Name: London Crown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: P.O. Box 31388, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
